Jesse: 1. If I have a notebook that takes some time to run e.g. some long data analysis, and I just want to play around with parts of it, then this is really annoying.
2. It is a glaring safety issue. Basically one should never open notebooks unless the source is very very trustworthy.

text: I also think having an option to switch off cells from running is a good idea. While teaching, when the students are opining the notebooks for the first time, it can take a substantial time before they start to see anything. In that case it might be nicer, we can run cell by cell. So they don’t feel like the notebook is slow.

text:
about running cells one by one, quoting from my message in <https://github.com/fonsp/Pluto.jl/issues/259> :
>  Running cells one by one used to be the default (before <https://github.com/fonsp/Pluto.jl/commit/d2015176af6ef437ad4feafedf1a01dae05426c9>), but there were too many problems with this that we could not fix with friendly UI - the issue is that you launch your notebook into a broken state by default - running a cell might error depending on which cells you manually ran before. It had a lot of the same state problems as Jupyter that reactivity should solve. (The goal is not to make ‘Jupyter++’, but to try something else.)
